$TSLA Should California spend $3 billion to help people buy electric cars?  http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-hy-electric-vehicle-subsidies-20170828-htmlstory.html

links.title: Should California spend $3 billion to help people buy electric cars?
links.description: Over seven years, the state of California has spent $449 million on consumer rebates to boost sales of zero-emission vehicles. So far, the subsidies haven't moved the needle much. In 2016, of the just over 2 million cars sold in the state, only 75,000 were pure-electric and plug-in hybrid cars.

links.title: A Canary in the Wall Street Coal Mine
links.description: Those who think today's stock market is unlike that of 2000, when baseless enthusiasm pushed stocks up to wild valuations, only to collapse in subsequent years, should take another look. Do they remember counting eyeballs as a basis for value? Once again, history and reality are replaced by dreams with little substance.

links.title: Tesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA): Tesla, Inc. (TSLA): Barron's News | StockNews.com
links.description: Tesla Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, and sells electric vehicles, electric vehicle powertrain components, and stationary energy storage systems in the United States, China, Norway, and internationally. The company was founded in 2003 and is based in Palo Alto, California. View our full TSLA ticker page with ratings, news, and more.

messages.body: $TSLA Tesla's short interest rose again this week, as more bears pile on. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-traders-are-getting-even-more-bearish-on-tesla-inc-tsla/

links.title: Traders Are Getting Even More Bearish On Tesla Inc (TSLA)
links.description: Without question, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) is one of the most polarizing stocks in the world. Market watchers generally fall into one of two camps on the company: proponents who think Tesla is poised to one day be the most popular automaker on earth, and critics that see it as a sort of publicly-funded Ponzi scheme, relying on huge debt and government subsidies while the shares are pumped ever higher.

links.title: Beautiful Joshua Tree Supervillain Lair For Sale For First Time
links.description: The listing calls this house "the most important architectural house you may have never seen" and yes yes yes, it's obviously flown under the radar for way too long. In the late '80s, artist Beverly Doolittle and her husband Jay decided they wanted a house on their 10 beautiful, naked acres in Joshua Tree and they tracked down super-organic architect Kendrick Bangs Kellogg, who immediately fell in love with the site.
